intro: Oenothera peruana, commonly known as the Peruvian evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oily seeds. Oenothera peruana is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species known for their medicinal and ornamental value. Its adaptability to high-altitude environments makes it a resilient species in its native habitat.
